gobblin.publisher

Class DataPublisher

  • java.lang.Object
    • gobblin.publisher.DataPublisher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SingleTaskDataPublisher

    public abstract class DataPublisher
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Closeable
    Defines how to publish data and its corresponding metadata. Can be used for either task level or job level publishing.

      abstract void initialize()
      Deprecated. 
      DataPublisher initialization should be done in the constructor.
      void publish(java.util.Collection<? extends WorkUnitState> states)
      First publish the metadata via publishMetadata(Collection), and then publish the output data via the publishData(Collection) method.
      abstract void publishData(java.util.Collection<? extends WorkUnitState> states)
      Publish the data for the given tasks.
      abstract void publishMetadata(java.util.Collection<? extends WorkUnitState> states)
      Publish the metadata (e.g., schema) for the given tasks.

      • publishData

      • publishMetadata

        public abstract void publishMetadata(java.util.Collection<? extends WorkUnitState> states)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        Publish the metadata (e.g., schema) for the given tasks. Checkpoints should not be published as part of metadata. They are published by Gobblin runtime after the metadata and data are published.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • publish

        public void publish(java.util.Collection<? extends WorkUnitState> states)
             throws java.io.IOException
        First publish the metadata via publishMetadata(Collection), and then publish the output data via the publishData(Collection) method.
        Parameters:
        states - is a Collection of WorkUnitStates.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is a problem with publishing the metadata or the data.

        public State getState()
